name: Barbell Bench Press
instructions: Lie on a flat bench with your feet planted on the floor.
Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Lower the bar slowly to your chest.
Press the bar back up to the starting position.
Keep your core engaged and avoid excessive arching of your back.
common_mistakes: Bouncing the bar off the chest.
Flaring the elbows too much.
Not maintaining proper wrist positioning.

name: Incline Barbell Bench Press
instructions: Set a bench to a 30-45 degree incline.
Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Lower the bar to the upper chest.
Press it back up, maintaining control.
common_mistakes: Using too steep of an incline, shifting focus to shoulders.
Bouncing the bar off the chest.

name: Decline Barbell Bench Press
instructions: Lie on a decline bench and secure your feet.
Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Lower the bar to your lower chest.
Press it back up while keeping control.
common_mistakes: Not using a spotter when lifting heavy.

name: Dumbbell Bench Press
instructions: Lie flat on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand.
Press the dumbbells up until arms are fully extended.
Lower them slowly while keeping control.
common_mistakes: Bringing the dumbbells together at the top, reducing tension.

name: Incline Dumbbell Press
instructions: Set a bench to a 30-45 degree incline.
Press the dumbbells up, extending your arms.
Lower them with control to your upper chest.
common_mistakes: Using excessive weight, leading to poor control.

name: Chest Dips
instructions: Grip the parallel bars and lift yourself.
Lean slightly forward to engage the chest more.
Lower yourself until your elbows reach 90 degrees.
Push back up explosively.
common_mistakes: Not leaning forward, turning the movement into a triceps dip.

name: Cable Flys
instructions: Stand between the cable stations and grab handles.
Step forward and bring your hands together in front of your chest.
Return to the starting position slowly.
common_mistakes: Using momentum instead of controlled movement.

name: Machine Chest Press
instructions: Adjust the seat height so the handles are at chest level.
Press the handles forward until your arms are extended.
Slowly return to the starting position.
common_mistakes: Locking out the elbows at the top, reducing tension.

name: Push-Ups
instructions: Start in a high plank position.
Lower your chest until it nearly touches the ground.
Push back up to the starting position.
common_mistakes: Letting the hips sag, reducing core engagement.

name: Dumbbell Flys
instructions: Lie flat on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand.
Extend your arms above your chest with a slight bend in the elbows.
Lower the dumbbells in a wide arc until your chest stretches.
Bring them back up in the same arc while squeezing your chest.
common_mistakes: Bending the elbows too much, turning it into a press.
Using momentum instead of controlled motion.

name: Pec Deck Machine
instructions: Adjust the seat so the handles are at chest level.
Grip the handles with a slight bend in your elbows.
Bring the handles together while squeezing your chest.
Slowly return to the starting position.
common_mistakes: Using excessive weight, leading to loss of control.
Not maintaining a slight bend in the elbows.

name: Smith Machine Bench Press
instructions: Lie on a flat bench under the Smith machine bar.
Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Lower the bar to your chest in a controlled manner.
Press it back up to the starting position.
common_mistakes: Locking out the elbows at the top.
Using a grip that is too narrow or too wide.

name: Landmine Press
instructions: Secure one end of a barbell in a landmine attachment or corner.
Grip the free end of the bar with both hands or one hand.
Press the bar forward until your arms are fully extended.
Lower it back in a controlled motion.
common_mistakes: Leaning too far forward, losing balance.
Using momentum instead of controlled pressing.

name: Svend Press
instructions: Hold a weight plate between your palms at chest level.
Squeeze the plate and press it forward.
Bring it back to your chest while maintaining the squeeze.
common_mistakes: Not squeezing the plate hard enough.
Letting the arms drop too low.

name: Close-Grip Bench Press
instructions: Lie on a flat bench and grip the barbell with hands shoulder-width apart.
Lower the bar to your lower chest while keeping your elbows tucked in.
Press the bar back up, fully extending your arms.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Using a grip that is too narrow, straining the wrists.
Flaring the elbows outward instead of keeping them close.

name: Triceps Dips
instructions: Grip the parallel bars and lift yourself up.
Keep your body upright and lower yourself until your elbows are at 90 degrees.
Press back up until your arms are fully extended.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Leaning too far forward, turning it into a chest dip.
Not going deep enough to engage the triceps.

name: Overhead Dumbbell Triceps Extension
instructions: Hold a dumbbell with both hands behind your head.
Keep your elbows close to your ears and extend your arms upward.
Slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Flaring the elbows outward instead of keeping them close.
Using excessive weight, compromising form.

name: Skull Crushers
instructions: Lie on a bench and hold an EZ bar with a narrow grip.
Lower the bar towards your forehead, keeping elbows stationary.
Extend your arms back up to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Letting the elbows move too much, reducing triceps activation.
Lowering the weight too far back, risking injury.

name: Cable Triceps Pushdown
instructions: Stand in front of a cable machine with a straight bar or rope attachment.
Grip the handle with palms facing down and elbows tucked in.
Push the bar down until your arms are fully extended.
Slowly return to the starting position.
common_mistakes: Using momentum instead of controlled movement.
Letting the elbows flare outward.

name: Diamond Push-Ups
instructions: Start in a push-up position with hands close together, forming a diamond shape.
Lower your chest towards your hands, keeping elbows tucked in.
Press back up to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Letting the elbows flare outward, reducing triceps activation.
Not maintaining a straight body posture.

name: Reverse-Grip Triceps Pushdown
instructions: Stand in front of a cable machine with a straight bar attachment.
Grip the bar with palms facing up (reverse grip).
Push the bar down until your arms are fully extended.
Slowly return to the starting position.
common_mistakes: Using too much weight, leading to improper form.
Letting the elbows move too much.

name: Bench Dips
instructions: Sit on a bench and place your hands shoulder-width apart on the edge.
Extend your legs in front of you and lower your body by bending your elbows.
Push yourself back up to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Not lowering yourself enough to fully engage the triceps.
Using momentum instead of controlled movement.

name: Barbell Biceps Curl
instructions: Stand upright holding a barbell with an underhand grip, shoulder-width apart.
Keep your elbows close to your body and curl the bar up to your chest.
Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Using momentum to swing the weight up.
Not fully extending the arms at the bottom.

name: Dumbbell Biceps Curl
instructions: Hold a dumbbell in each hand with a supinated grip (palms facing forward).
Keep your elbows close to your torso and curl the dumbbells up.
Slowly lower the weights back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Swinging the dumbbells instead of using controlled movement.
Not fully extending the arms at the bottom.

name: Hammer Curl
instructions: Hold a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip (palms facing inward).
Keep your elbows close to your body and curl the weights up.
Slowly lower back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Using too much weight, leading to swinging.
Not keeping the elbows close to the torso.

name: Preacher Curl
instructions: Sit on a preacher bench and rest your arms on the pad.
Hold an EZ bar with an underhand grip and curl the weight up.
Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Not using full range of motion.
Using excessive weight, leading to improper form.

name: Concentration Curl
instructions: Sit on a bench and hold a dumbbell with an underhand grip.
Rest your elbow on the inside of your thigh and curl the weight up.
Slowly lower the dumbbell back down.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Using momentum to lift the weight.
Not fully extending the arm at the bottom.

name: Cable Biceps Curl
instructions: Stand in front of a cable machine with a straight bar attachment.
Grip the bar with palms facing up and curl it towards your shoulders.
Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Leaning back to lift more weight.
Not fully extending the arms at the bottom.

name: Incline Dumbbell Curl
instructions: Sit on an incline bench with dumbbells in each hand.
Keep your arms fully extended and curl the weights up.
Slowly lower them back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Not keeping the back fully against the bench.
Using momentum to swing the weights up.

name: Reverse Curl
instructions: Hold a barbell with an overhand grip (palms facing down).
Keep your elbows close and curl the bar up.
Slowly lower it back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Using too much weight, causing improper form.
Not keeping wrists in a neutral position.

name: Spider Curl
instructions: Lie on an incline bench facing forward, chest resting on the pad.
Hold an EZ bar and let your arms hang down.
Curl the bar up towards your shoulders, keeping elbows stationary.
Slowly lower back down.
common_mistakes: Using excessive weight, compromising form.
Moving elbows too much during the curl.

name: Zottman Curl
instructions: Hold a dumbbell in each hand with a supinated grip.
Curl the dumbbells up, then rotate your wrists to a pronated grip at the top.
Slowly lower the weights back down.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Not controlling the eccentric (lowering) phase.
Using momentum instead of muscle contraction.

name: 21s Biceps Curl
instructions: Hold a barbell with an underhand grip at shoulder-width.
Perform 7 reps from the bottom to halfway up.
Perform 7 reps from halfway to the top.
Perform 7 full-range reps.
Repeat for the desired number of sets.
common_mistakes: Using momentum to lift the weight.
Not completing the full range of motion.

name: Bayesian Curl
instructions: Attach a single handle to a cable machine at the lowest setting.
Stand with your back to the machine, holding the handle in one hand.
Step forward slightly, allowing your arm to extend behind you.
Curl the handle toward your shoulder and slowly lower it back.
Repeat and switch arms.
common_mistakes: Not keeping the shoulder stable.
Using too much weight, leading to improper form.

name: Drag Curl
instructions: Hold a barbell with an underhand grip, shoulder-width apart.
Pull the bar up along your body, keeping your elbows behind your torso.
Stop at chest level and slowly lower it back.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Not keeping the bar close to the body.
Using momentum instead of strict form.

name: Standing Alternating Dumbbell Curl
instructions: Hold a dumbbell in each hand with a supinated grip.
Curl one dumbbell up while keeping the other arm relaxed.
Lower the dumbbell and switch arms.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Swinging the dumbbells instead of controlled movement.
Not keeping the elbows close to the torso.

name: Cross-Body Hammer Curl
instructions: Hold a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip.
Curl one dumbbell across your body toward the opposite shoulder.
Lower back and repeat with the other arm.
Continue alternating for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Not keeping the core tight and stable.
Using too much weight, leading to momentum.

name: Machine Biceps Curl
instructions: Sit on a biceps curl machine and grip the handles.
Keep your elbows fixed and curl the weight up.
Slowly lower the handles back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Leaning forward too much.
Not using a full range of motion.

name: Seated Dumbbell Curl
instructions: Sit on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand.
Keep your elbows close to your body and curl the weights up.
Slowly lower them back down.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Leaning back or swinging the weights.
Not fully extending the arms.

name: Reverse-Grip Cable Curl
instructions: Attach a straight bar to the cable machine and hold it with an overhand grip.
Curl the bar towards your shoulders.
Slowly lower it back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Using excessive weight, causing wrist strain.
Not controlling the movement.

name: Dumbbell Spider Curl
instructions: Lie on an incline bench, chest resting on the pad.
Hold a dumbbell in each hand with a supinated grip.
Curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders.
Lower them back down slowly.
common_mistakes: Using momentum instead of strict form.
Not fully extending the arms at the bottom.

name: Resistance Band Biceps Curl
instructions: Stand on a resistance band and hold the handles with an underhand grip.
Curl the handles up toward your shoulders.
Slowly lower them back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Using too much band resistance, leading to improper form.
Not keeping elbows stable.

name: Hanging Leg Raises
instructions: Hang from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip.
Keep your legs straight and raise them to a 90-degree angle.
Slowly lower them back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Swinging the legs instead of controlled movement.
Not engaging the core properly.

name: Ab Rollout
instructions: Kneel on the floor and grip the ab wheel handles.
Roll forward slowly, extending your body while keeping your core tight.
Roll back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Arching the back instead of keeping it neutral.
Using momentum instead of controlled movement.

name: Cable Crunch
instructions: Attach a rope to the high pulley of a cable machine.
Kneel down and grip the rope with both hands near your head.
Crunch down towards the floor while keeping the rope close to your head.
Slowly return to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Pulling with the arms instead of using the abs.
Not keeping the core engaged.

name: Decline Sit-Ups
instructions: Lie on a decline bench and secure your feet.
Cross your arms over your chest or place them behind your head.
Sit up while engaging your core.
Slowly lower back down.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Using momentum instead of core strength.
Straining the neck by pulling with the hands.

name: Hanging Windshield Wipers
instructions: Hang from a pull-up bar and lift your legs to a 90-degree angle.
Rotate your legs from side to side like a windshield wiper.
Keep your core engaged throughout the movement.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Swinging the legs too fast instead of controlled movement.
Not keeping the core engaged.

name: Plank to Shoulder Tap
instructions: Start in a high plank position with hands under your shoulders.
Lift one hand to tap the opposite shoulder.
Return the hand to the ground and switch sides.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Rotating the hips instead of keeping them stable.
Not engaging the core properly.

name: Russian Twists
instructions: Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet slightly elevated.
Hold a medicine ball with both hands.
Twist your torso to the left, then to the right.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Moving too fast and losing control.
Not engaging the core fully.

name: V-Ups
instructions: Lie on your back with legs extended and arms overhead.
Lift your legs and upper body simultaneously to form a 'V' shape.
Slowly lower back down.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Bending the knees instead of keeping legs straight.
Not controlling the movement.

name: Bicycle Crunches
instructions: Lie on your back and place your hands behind your head.
Lift your legs off the ground and alternate touching each elbow to the opposite knee.
Continue pedaling in a controlled motion.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Pulling the neck instead of using core strength.
Using momentum instead of controlled movement.

name: Toe Touches
instructions: Lie on your back and extend your legs upward.
Reach your hands towards your toes while lifting your upper back off the floor.
Lower back down slowly.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Using momentum instead of core control.
Not fully engaging the abs.

name: Overhead Barbell Press
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and grip the barbell at shoulder level.
Press the bar overhead until your arms are fully extended.
Lower the bar back down to shoulder level with control.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Excessive arching of the back.
Incomplete range of motion.

name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
instructions: Sit on a bench with back support holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level.
Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended.
Lower them slowly back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Allowing the dumbbells to drift forward.
Using momentum instead of controlled movement.

name: Arnold Press
instructions: Start with dumbbells held in front of your shoulders, palms facing your body.
Rotate your palms outward as you press the weights overhead.
Reverse the movement on the way down to return to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Improper wrist rotation.
Using excessive weight leading to poor form.

name: Lateral Raise
instructions: Stand with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
Lift your arms out to the sides until they are parallel to the floor.
Slowly lower the weights back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Swinging the weights or using momentum.
Lifting too high, which can stress the shoulder joint.

name: Front Raise
instructions: Stand with a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs.
Raise the weights straight in front of you until they are parallel to the floor.
Lower them back down slowly with control.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Using momentum or swinging the weights.
Raising the weights too high, which can cause shoulder strain.

name: Rear Delt Fly
instructions: Bend forward at the hips with a slight bend in the knees.
Hold a dumbbell in each hand with arms extended downward.
Raise your arms out to the sides until they are parallel to the ground.
Slowly lower them back down.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Rounding the back instead of keeping it neutral.
Using weights that are too heavy, compromising form.

name: Upright Row
instructions: Hold a barbell with an overhand grip in front of your thighs.
Pull the barbell upward along your torso until it reaches chin level.
Lower the barbell slowly back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Lifting too heavy, which may lead to shoulder impingement.
Pulling the weight too high or using jerky movements.

name: Cable Face Pull
instructions: Set the cable at face level and attach a rope handle.
Grab the rope with both hands and pull it towards your face with elbows flared out.
Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the peak.
Slowly return to the starting position and repeat.
common_mistakes: Using too heavy a weight, which compromises form.
Not keeping the elbows high during the movement.

name: Barbell Push Press
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart holding a barbell at shoulder level.
Dip your knees slightly and use your leg drive to help press the bar overhead.
Fully extend your arms at the top before lowering the bar back down.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Relying solely on upper body strength instead of using leg drive.
Not controlling the descent of the barbell.

name: Seated Dumbbell Lateral Raise
instructions: Sit on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
With a slight bend in the elbows, lift the dumbbells out to the side until they reach shoulder height.
Slowly lower the weights back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Using momentum to swing the weights.
Lifting too high, which may stress the shoulder joints.

name: Pull-Ups
instructions: Grip the pull-up bar with palms facing away (overhand) at shoulder-width.
Pull your body upward until your chin passes the bar.
Lower yourself slowly back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Kipping or using momentum to complete the rep.
Not fully extending the arms at the bottom.

name: Lat Pulldown
instructions: Sit at the lat pulldown machine and grasp the bar with a wide grip.
Pull the bar down towards your chest while squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Slowly return the bar to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Leaning back excessively during the pull.
Using momentum instead of controlled movement.

name: Bent-Over Barbell Row
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, bend at the hips with a slight knee bend.
Grip the barbell with an overhand or mixed grip.
Pull the barbell towards your lower ribcage while keeping your back flat.
Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Rounding the back during the movement.
Using momentum instead of controlled muscle contraction.

name: Seated Cable Row
instructions: Sit at the cable row machine with feet braced against the platform.
Grab the handle with both hands and extend your arms fully.
Pull the handle towards your torso while squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Slowly return to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Leaning too far back or using excessive momentum.
Not fully retracting the shoulder blades.

name: T-Bar Row
equipment: T-Bar Row Machine or Barbell with a V-handle
instructions: Stand over the T-bar row setup with feet shoulder-width apart.
Bend slightly at the hips while keeping your back flat.
Grasp the handles and pull the weight towards your chest.
Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Rounding the back during the pull.
Using a jerking motion to lift the weight.

name: Single-Arm Dumbbell Row
instructions: Place one knee and hand on a bench for support.
Hold a dumbbell in the opposite hand with a neutral grip.
Pull the dumbbell upward towards your hip while squeezing your back muscles.
Slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps and switch sides.
common_mistakes: Twisting the torso during the row.
Using momentum instead of focusing on the back muscles.

name: Inverted Row
instructions: Set a barbell in a Smith machine at waist height or use suspension straps.
Lie underneath and grip the bar with an overhand grip.
Keep your body straight and pull your chest up towards the bar.
Slowly lower back down to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Allowing the hips to sag or pike.
Using a jerky motion instead of a controlled pull.

name: Deadlift
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart with the barbell over your mid-foot.
Bend at the hips and knees to grip the bar with an overhand or mixed grip.
Keep your back flat as you lift the bar by extending your hips and knees.
Stand upright, then lower the bar back down with control.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Rounding the back during the lift.
Using too much weight and sacrificing form.

name: Machine Row
instructions: Sit on the machine and adjust the seat and chest pad if necessary.
Grip the handles and pull them towards your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Leaning back excessively.
Not fully contracting the back muscles during the pull.

name: Good Mornings
instructions: Place a barbell on your upper back and stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
Keep a slight bend in your knees and hinge at the hips to lower your torso forward.
Stop when your torso is roughly parallel to the floor.
Return to the starting position by engaging your lower back and glutes.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Rounding the back during the movement.
Lowering too far and risking strain on the lower back.

name: Barbell Back Squat
instructions: Position a barbell across your upper back and stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
Keep your chest up and core engaged as you lower into a squat until your thighs are parallel to the floor.
Drive through your heels to return to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Letting the knees cave inward.
Rounding the back during the descent.
Not reaching an adequate depth.

name: Leg Press
instructions: Sit on the leg press machine with your feet placed shoulder-width apart on the platform.
Slowly lower the platform until your knees are at a 90-degree angle.
Push the platform back up by extending your legs, without locking your knees.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Allowing the knees to collapse inward.
Not using full range of motion.

name: Bulgarian Split Squat
instructions: Stand a few feet in front of a bench and place one foot behind you on the bench.
Lower your body by bending the front knee until the thigh is parallel to the ground.
Push through the heel to return to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch legs.
common_mistakes: Allowing the front knee to extend too far forward.
Leaning too far forward, which reduces glute engagement.

name: Romanian Deadlift
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart holding a barbell in front of your thighs.
Keep a slight bend in your knees and hinge at the hips, lowering the bar while keeping your back straight.
Lower until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings, then return to the starting position by extending your hips.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Rounding the back during the movement.
Lowering the bar too far, which may lead to injury.

name: Walking Lunges
instructions: Stand upright and take a step forward with one leg.
Lower your body until both knees are at 90-degree angles.
Push through the front heel to bring the back leg forward into the next lunge.
Continue walking forward, alternating legs.
common_mistakes: Allowing the front knee to pass the toes.
Leaning forward, which shifts balance.

name: Leg Extensions
instructions: Sit on the leg extension machine with your ankles under the padded lever.
Extend your legs fully until they are straight, squeezing the quadriceps at the top.
Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Locking out the knees at the top.
Using excessive weight which may strain the knee joint.

name: Hamstring Curls
instructions: Lie face down (or sit, depending on the machine) and position your ankles under the padded lever.
Curl your legs upward by contracting your hamstrings.
Slowly lower back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Using too heavy a weight, leading to loss of control.
Not performing a full range of motion.

name: Calf Raises
instructions: Stand on a raised platform with your heels hanging off the edge.
Rise up onto your toes as high as possible, contracting your calf muscles.
Slowly lower your heels below the platform level.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Using momentum instead of a controlled motion.
Not achieving a full range of motion.

name: Glute Bridge
instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
Lift your hips upward by squeezing your glutes until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
Hold the contraction for a moment, then lower your hips back down.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Not fully contracting the glutes at the top.
Overextending the lower back.

name: Step-Ups
instructions: Stand in front of a bench or sturdy box.
Step onto the bench with one foot, pressing through the heel to lift your body upward.
Lower yourself back down with control and alternate legs.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Using momentum instead of controlled movement.
Not fully extending the stepping leg at the top.

name: Dumbbell Wrist Curl
instructions: Sit on a bench and rest your forearms on your thighs with your wrists hanging over the edge, palms up.
Hold a dumbbell in each hand and curl your wrists upward by contracting your forearm muscles.
Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Using too heavy a weight and swinging the arms.
Not controlling the movement on the way down.

name: Dumbbell Reverse Wrist Curl
instructions: Sit on a bench and rest your forearms on your thighs with your wrists hanging over the edge, palms down.
Hold a dumbbell in each hand and lift the back of your hands by extending your wrists.
Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Using momentum instead of a controlled motion.
Incorrect wrist positioning that reduces effectiveness.

name: Farmer's Walk
instructions: Stand upright holding a heavy pair of dumbbells or specialized handles at your sides.
Walk a set distance or for a set period while maintaining good posture and a firm grip.
Focus on keeping your core engaged throughout the movement.
common_mistakes: Poor posture or allowing the shoulders to slump.
Dropping the weights too quickly due to a loose grip.

name: Plate Pinch Hold
instructions: Hold two weight plates together with your fingers and thumb in a pinch grip.
Keep your arms at your sides and hold for as long as possible.
Release slowly and repeat for the desired duration or sets.
common_mistakes: Not engaging the core, which may lead to instability.
Allowing the plates to slip due to improper grip.

name: Wrist Roller
instructions: Stand holding a wrist roller with both hands and arms extended in front of you.
Roll the weight upward by twisting your wrists, then slowly lower it back down.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Using jerky movements instead of smooth, controlled rotations.
Not completing the full range of motion.

name: Towel Hang
instructions: Drape a towel over a pull-up bar and grab both ends firmly.
Hang with your feet off the ground for as long as possible, focusing on maintaining a strong grip.
Lower yourself safely after the hold.
common_mistakes: Allowing the shoulders to shrug or the core to relax.
Not maintaining a steady grip throughout the exercise.

name: Static Barbell Hold
instructions: Load a barbell with a moderate weight and lift it to arm's length.
Hold the barbell steady with a firm grip for as long as possible.
Focus on maintaining proper posture and tension in your forearms.
common_mistakes: Slouching or losing grip strength due to fatigue.
Not keeping the arms fully extended.

name: Finger Curls
instructions: Hold a barbell with an overhand grip and let it roll down to your fingertips.
Curl your fingers to bring the barbell back into your palm.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Using too heavy a weight, causing uncontrolled movement.
Not fully extending the fingers on the eccentric phase.

name: Rice Bucket Training
instructions: Fill a bucket with rice and submerge your hands fully.
Perform various movements such as squeezing, twisting, and digging your fingers through the rice.
Continue for a set period to work on forearm strength and endurance.
common_mistakes: Using excessive force which can lead to strain.
Not moving through the full range of motion with your fingers.

name: Reverse Plate Curl
instructions: Hold a weight plate with an overhand grip, keeping your arms straight.
Curl your fingers upward slightly to engage the forearm muscles.
Hold briefly at the top before releasing back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
common_mistakes: Relying on momentum rather than controlled movement.
Not maintaining a steady grip throughout the exercise.

name: Outdoor Running
instructions: Wear proper running shoes and dress appropriately for the weather.
Start with a light warm-up jog for 5-10 minutes.
Run at a steady pace, focusing on proper posture and breathing.
Cool down with a walk and stretching after your run.
common_mistakes: Overstriding and poor posture.
Skipping the warm-up or cool-down.

name: Treadmill Running
instructions: Set the treadmill to a comfortable pace and incline.
Begin with a warm-up walk for 5 minutes.
Increase the speed gradually to reach your desired running pace.
Cool down with a slow walk and stretch.
common_mistakes: Over-relying on treadmill safety handles.
Setting the speed too high too soon.

name: Outdoor Cycling
instructions: Wear a helmet and proper cycling gear.
Begin cycling at a moderate pace on a safe route.
Focus on maintaining steady pedaling and proper bike posture.
Cool down by gradually slowing your pace and stretching.
common_mistakes: Not adjusting the bike seat height correctly.
Ignoring safety rules on busy roads.

name: Stationary Bike
instructions: Adjust the seat height for comfort.
Begin with a 5-minute warm-up at low resistance.
Increase resistance and pace for a steady workout session.
Cool down by gradually reducing resistance and pedaling speed.
common_mistakes: Improper seat adjustment leading to knee strain.
Not maintaining proper posture.

name: Jump Rope
instructions: Choose a jump rope of appropriate length.
Begin with single jumps at a moderate pace.
Focus on landing softly on the balls of your feet.
Increase speed or try double-unders as you progress.
common_mistakes: Jumping too high, leading to inefficient movement.
Not maintaining a steady rhythm.

name: Rowing Machine
instructions: Sit on the rowing machine and secure your feet.
Start with a proper catch position and drive using your legs.
Lean back slightly and pull the handle towards your torso.
Reverse the motion smoothly to return to the starting position.
common_mistakes: Overusing arms instead of legs.
Not maintaining proper posture during the stroke.

name: Elliptical Trainer
instructions: Step onto the elliptical and adjust the resistance.
Maintain an upright posture and begin moving smoothly.
Use the handles to engage your upper body.
Cool down by gradually reducing speed and resistance.
common_mistakes: Leaning on the handles instead of using them for guidance.
Overstriding which can lead to joint discomfort.

name: Stair Climber
instructions: Step onto the machine and adjust settings for a moderate pace.
Keep your back straight and engage your core.
Focus on a steady and controlled stepping motion.
Cool down with a slower pace towards the end of your session.
common_mistakes: Leaning heavily on the machine rails.
Taking steps too quickly, which can reduce workout quality.

name: HIIT Sprints
instructions: Warm up with a light jog for 5-10 minutes.
Sprint at maximum effort for 20-30 seconds.
Recover with a walk or light jog for 60-90 seconds.
Repeat for 8-10 rounds.
common_mistakes: Not warming up properly, leading to injury.
Pacing yourself too conservatively during sprints.

name: Burpees
instructions: Begin in a standing position.
Drop into a squat and place your hands on the floor.
Kick your feet back into a push-up position.
Perform a push-up, then quickly return your feet to the squat position.
Explosively jump into the air and repeat.
common_mistakes: Rushing through the movement, which can compromise form.
Not engaging the core during transitions.

name: Mountain Climbers
instructions: Begin in a high plank position with hands under your shoulders.
Bring one knee towards your chest, then quickly switch legs in a running motion.
Maintain a steady pace while keeping your core engaged.
Continue alternating legs for the desired duration.
common_mistakes: Dropping the hips or losing core stability.
Moving too slowly, which reduces the cardio benefit.

name: Jumping Jacks
instructions: Stand upright with feet together and arms at your sides.
Jump while spreading your legs and raising your arms overhead.
Jump again to return to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps or time duration.
variations: Modified Jumping Jacks (step out instead of jump)
common_mistakes: Not fully extending the arms or legs.
Using excessive force that can lead to injury.

name: Kickboxing
instructions: Start with a light warm-up to get the blood flowing.
Perform a series of punches and kicks in a controlled manner.
Focus on technique, speed, and power.
Cool down with light stretches after the session.
common_mistakes: Overextending movements and risking injury.
Not maintaining proper stance or balance.

name: Dancing Aerobics
instructions: Choose upbeat music and clear a safe space for movement.
Follow a choreographed routine or freestyle with high-energy moves.
Focus on keeping a steady pace and engaging your whole body.
Cool down with slow movements and stretching.
common_mistakes: Overexerting without proper warm-up.
Neglecting to maintain balance during fast moves.

name: Swimming
instructions: Warm up with light swimming or water jogging.
Choose a stroke (freestyle, backstroke, etc.) and maintain a steady pace.
Focus on breathing rhythm and efficient strokes.
Cool down with gentle swimming and stretching in the water.
common_mistakes: Poor breathing technique leading to fatigue.
Overexertion without a proper warm-up.

name: Spin Class
instructions: Adjust the spin bike settings for comfort and proper resistance.
Follow the instructors cues for speed, resistance, and posture.
Maintain a steady pace and focus on controlled breathing.
Cool down with lower resistance and stretching post-session.
common_mistakes: Improper bike setup leading to discomfort.
Not adjusting resistance to match workout intensity.

name: Battle Ropes
instructions: Anchor the battle ropes securely.
Hold an end in each hand and create waves by rapidly moving your arms.
Maintain a strong stance with knees slightly bent.
Perform for a set time or number of intervals.
common_mistakes: Using only the arms without engaging the core.
Overexerting which may compromise form.

name: Circuit Training
instructions: Design a circuit of 5-10 exercises that target different muscle groups.
Perform each exercise for 30-60 seconds with minimal rest in between.
Complete the circuit 2-3 times.
Cool down with stretching after the session.
common_mistakes: Not pacing yourself through the circuit.
Skipping rest intervals leading to premature fatigue.

name: Skipping
instructions: Hold a jump rope and choose a comfortable pace.
Jump lightly, keeping your knees slightly bent.
Maintain a rhythmic pace and proper form.
Continue for a set time or number of jumps.
common_mistakes: Jumping too high and wasting energy.
Not maintaining consistent rhythm.

name: Hiking
instructions: Choose a scenic trail with varying terrain.
Wear proper hiking boots and carry water and snacks.
Hike at a steady pace, adjusting your speed for inclines and declines.
Take breaks as needed and enjoy the outdoors.
common_mistakes: Not wearing appropriate footwear.
Overexerting early without proper pacing.
